title: I didn't know "LOL YOU DID THE LEAST DAMAGE," was a valid argument against someone.
body:
Someone said this to me when I was playing ADC LeBlanc mentioning that Morgana (our supp) did more damage than me.

I didn't know this was meant to be a valid argument.

Like hey let's just say you did the least amount of damage and not even take into account of why that may be.

Considering that I couldn't ever do damage with the follow champions on the enemy team: {{champion:23}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:157}} 

You know because the second I W in they'll 100-0 me, even at a far distance, they'll just jump on me and proceed to destroy my health bar while I can't do shit about it besides try to run away and repeat it all over again.

I mean am I missing something?

It seems like a flawed argument to me but is it now some valid argument everybody and their mothers is using when they don't feel like focusing on their own mistakes?
